author: etan_status
content:
in any backfill protocol, the backfilled data has to be verifiable by the node downloading it. 
proving that data was present on some other orphaned fork of the chain is challenging, and may also not be expected -- orphaned data is not exposed on any other RPCs as well except query specifically by root for introspection / debugging purpose.
so, with this PR, it is ensured that only canonical data is collected.
that canonical data is provable using historical roots, and a backfill protocol can be built based on the canonical data
